intro: Ageratum lineare, commonly known as linear ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves and vibrant blue to purple flower heads. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and floral arrangements. Ageratum lineare is also popular for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
